page.title: 08Hall Lane-Road that changed
page.content: Hall Lane (B5240) used to be a country road joining the villages of Burscough & Skelmersdale. Now Skelmersdale is a new town and the M6 and M58 have been built nearby. Hall Lane runs past our school & many people think it is dangerous. Huge lorries travel along it -some go over the 60m.p.h. speed limit. We tested speed of traffic and some did 100m. in less than 4 secs. A lot of container lorries go south to Skelmersdale from haulage copmpanies in Burscough. They take empty cans to be filled with Coke. They spit up the stones and make a wind as they go past. It is difficult to walk or cycle safely on Hall Lane. The policeman says it is not a dangerous road because there were only 6 accidents in a year. He says a new bypass road will soon be built. Our Infant Teacher says "They have been saying that for 25 years!"
